data.title: Depth data isn't rendered anymore
data.body: The whole world just gets uniformly black.

data.title: Improve WithShadow
data.body:
Makes the trait public, upgradable and the offset customizable.

Uses the customizable offset to tweak shadow position of TD and RA aircraft, which looks a little better especially for landed aircraft (they no longer completely hide the shadow).

data.title: Introduce Actor.IsObscuredByFog
data.body:
@RoosterDragon mentioned that `self.World.FogObscures(self)` is rather expensive.

It might help performance if we performed that check for the actor directly and then made actor `Renderables` like `WithParachute` just read the result, instead of performing their own `FogObscures` check.

data.title: Some TS building artwork offsets are wrong
data.body: Testing #10715 shows that the hand of nod and a bunch of civilian structures have offsets are a few px off.  It would be good to go through and use the automatically generated offsets everywhere.

data.title: Remove spurious space in TS' mod.yaml
data.body:
Introduced in 27699ce3d732ff448a15dde771c5aab5c38542b3 for seemingly no reason.

As far as I am aware we shouldn't be parsing this properly, but apparently we are.

data.title: Fix path to redalert.mix in ra/mod.yaml
data.body: Turned up while testing #11462.

data.title: Add foundation for player experience tracking
data.body:
Adds a `PlayerExperience` trait, first and foremost. The experience is added to by killing units with the `GivesExperience` trait. That behaviour can be removed by setting the `GivesExperienceInfo.PlayerExperienceModifier` to 0 (the default). The trait can otherwise be used to simply track a score, for example in Lua scripts.

The original PR enabled the feature in the existing mods, both in the rules and the UI. I'm not sure if we should actually do that. I added the rules changes as a test case, and split off the UI changes into a separate commit so that they can be easily removed, if we decide that way.

Supersedes #10358.

//cc: @Phoib

data.title: Disable hide map crate if explored map is enabled.
data.body:
Suggested by lucassss in http://www.sleipnirstuff.com/forum/viewtopic.php?t=19622.

While it could certainly be argued that the hide map penalty remains valid, I think it is reasonable to treat the player's choice to explore the map as a request to disable the shroud completely.  This is also consistent with our original disabled-shroud behavior.

data.title: Map import includes x.vqa videos
data.body: This isn't the wanted behaviour, according to https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/11368#discussion_r65608549

data.title: Fix smudges in nod07-nod08 missions
data.body:
Fixes #11449.

The Importer works fine regarding smudges,.. I've just screwed up at updating old mapfiles (I've started working on nod07-nod08 back in October 2015) See nod09 which I've started working on in April 2016. **Note: The fix has been generated by porting the mapfiles with the newest bleed of openra.**

data.title: Fix Mobile.IsMovingInMyDirection check.
data.body:
The old code would always return false (because `selfMobile.ToCell == self.Location` by definition), so check has effectively been a no-op for years.

My tests indicate a huge improvement to unit behavior across bridges as long as you issue move orders far enough past the bridge that you are outside the 8-cell `nearEnough` radius that will cause units to give up and stop on/in front of the bridge.

data.title: Fix initial server map randomization.
data.body:
This was previously trying to use values that had not yet been initialised, which meant that _all_ maps were treated as unsuitable.  This would cause the mod to always fall back to the first installed map.

Moving this to MapCache means avoids that subtlety, and fixes the issue.

data.title: Expose ParachutableInfo.
Fixed some minor issues in the new mod content extraction.
data.body: Some inconsistencies I came across when reading through the new source code introduced in https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/11375.

data.title: Do not remove empty entries in MiniYaml.FromString
data.body:
This will fix cases of incorrect line numbers being reported.

http://logs.openra.net/?year=2016&month=06&day=17#15:34:02

> [15:34:02]  [Phrohdoh] Oh, duh. Empty lines are stripped before the IEnumerable<string> is passed to FromLines, so that is why my line numbers are off.
> [15:34:29]  [Phrohdoh] Outside of not removing those, that isn't fixable.
> [15:34:40]  [pchote] is this in your code, or ours?
> [15:34:43]  [Phrohdoh] upstream
> [15:34:53]  [Phrohdoh] return FromLines(text.Split(new[] { "\r\n", "\n" }, StringSplitOptions.RemoveEmptyEntries), fileName);
> [15:35:00]  [Phrohdoh] MiniYaml:257
> [15:35:01]  [pchote] lets not do that, then
> [15:35:17]  [pchote] discard them at parse time, incrementing the line counter to mathc
> [15:35:19]  [pchote] *match
> [15:35:23]  [Phrohdoh] ok

data.title: Improve AI MCV deployment
data.body:
While #11308 has merit of its own, it doesn't really solve #11305.

Instead, I took a closer look at the AI MCV deployment code. This PR fixes the two more problematic out of three issues I could find:
- The first is that the AI was spamming orders even to MCVs that were already on the move.
- The second is that the AI often chose locations near the enemy base, usually resulting in the MCV's destruction before it's even deployed.

The third is that `ChooseBuildLocation` works rather poorly in practice, sometimes choosing locations where some obstacle doesn't allow deployment, but fixing that will be harder and is therefore left for some other time.

The commits should be descriptive enough, so I won't repeat the details here.

data.title: Extract installer data using direct stream-stream copies
data.body:
The old implementation would read all the data into a memory buffer and then dump that buffer to disk as two separate options.  This is bad for the UI (no way to measure progress) and for memory (because we need to load entire files into memory â€“ potentially twice).

This removes the intermediate memory buffers and adds (XX%) indicators to the installation progress UI.

data.title: Prompt FMV installation when trying to play a missing video.
data.body: This adds multi-line support and reduces duplication in our dialog prompts, and then uses this to display an information dialog when trying to play a video that isn't installed.

data.title: Fix damage of RA/TD minigunners and RA Jeep vs. Heavy armor
data.body: Fixes #11425.

data.body:
By only considering weapons valid versus the selected target.

Additionally adressed helicopter-related TODOs regarding weapons that are out of ammo and need reloading (they are now considered invalid weapons until their ammo is replenished).

Fixes #11430.
Probably fixes #7499.

data.title: Disable single-player games by default on dedicated servers
data.body: Rationale: it's stupid to allow single players to hog someone else's server by themselves by default. This change would force them to use the single-player lobby instead.

data.title: Black Artifacts all over after first Launch
data.body: Upon launches after initial launch, various black squares appear all over the screen and constantly change like static.

data.title: Game crashes when loading/unloading pillboxes while they force fire

milestone.title: release-20161015
milestone.description: Stability release with burning trees and video installation.

data.body:
Steps to reproduction: 
- build 2 (nearby) pillboxes and 2 two additional infantry units
- force-fire pillboxes (ground will do)
- unload infantry 
- load other infantry units with the 'alt' key
- unload again
- move infantry around
- maybe repeat loading/unloading few more times (cycling through your 4 infantry units). 

after a couple of rounds you'll notice some weird behaviour with the infantry sticking to the pillboxes when ordered to move. Once this happens, load a infantry unit into a pillbox and the game will crash. 

Here is the error:

```

  at System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary`2[OpenRA.Actor,OpenRA.Traits.IFacing].Insert (OpenRA.Actor key, IFacing value, Boolean add) [0x0008e] in /private/tmp/source-mono-mac-4.0.0-bug-33585-hotfix/bockbuild-mono-4.0.0-branch/profiles/mono-mac-xamarin/build-root/mono-4.0.4/external/referencesource/mscorlib/system/collections/generic/dictionary.cs:329 
  at System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary`2[OpenRA.Actor,OpenRA.Traits.IFacing].Add (OpenRA.Actor key, IFacing value) [0x00000] in /private/tmp/source-mono-mac-4.0.0-bug-33585-hotfix/bockbuild-mono-4.0.0-branch/profiles/mono-mac-xamarin/build-root/mono-4.0.4/external/referencesource/mscorlib/system/collections/generic/dictionary.cs:185 
  at OpenRA.Mods.Common.Traits.AttackGarrisoned.OpenRA.Mods.Common.Traits.INotifyPassengerEntered.OnPassengerEntered (OpenRA.Actor self, OpenRA.Actor passenger) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Mods.Common.Traits.Cargo.Load (OpenRA.Actor self, OpenRA.Actor a) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Mods.Common.Activities.EnterTransport+<OnInside>c__AnonStorey0.<>m__0 (OpenRA.World w) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0
```

data.title: PlayerExperience - statistic
data.body:
i thought we could track actions (support/teamplay-actions) and reward those with experience at the end of a game in the statistic. ideas for such actions : 
- [ ] placing defense-stuctures (pillbox, coils, turrets, flame-towers) inside a team-members buildradius (not overlapped by your own buildradius ~~and selling the structures shortly after should remove the points?~~) [ each structure = x-amount of points]
- [ ] damaging enemy-units from within a team-members buildradius (not overlapped by your buildradius)
  x-amount of hp = x-amount of points
- [ ] repair bridges [  x-amount of hp = x-amount of points]
- [x] sending supply-trucks to a team-member [ each truck = x-amount of points]
- [ ] unloading harvester on team-members refinery [ x-amount of money = x amount of points]
- [ ] reloading team-members units [ x-amount of shells/pips = x-amount of points]
- [ ] transporting team-members unit x-amount of cells [ each transported unit + x-amount of cells = x-amount of points]
- [x] repairing team-members building with the repair-button [ x-amount of hp = x-amount of points]
- [ ] repairing team-members building with an engineer
- [x] repairing team-members units with on a repair pad
- [x] capture enemy buildings
- [x] kill a enemy unit

Faction-Specific
- [x] infiltrate enemy buildings
- [ ] repair team-members units with mechanic [ x-amount of hp = x-amount of points]
- [ ] heal team-members units with medic
- [ ] use spyplane/paratroops [ each use/drop = x-amount of points]
- [ ] crono team-members units [ every unit + x-amount of time = x-amount of points]
  ~~here should be a exception for counting teleported "enemy-units" too,  as this can happen for defense-reasons?~~
- [ ] curtain team-members units [ every unit + x-amount of time = x-amount of points]

data.title: Port map difficulties to new lobby options backend.
data.body:
This introduces a new `ScriptLobbyDropdown` trait that, in the future (along with a `ScriptLobbyCheckbox`) will let mappers define arbitrary lobby options that can be queried from lua.

This new trait duplicates exactly the behaviour that we want from the map difficulty selector, so that is now reimplemented using this trait.

This gets us another step closer to unhardcoding the lobby options UI.
